snippet: After four Democratic state senators orchestrated a coup that temporarily paralyzed state government, two are headed to prison, and one, Pedro Espada Jr., is being tried on corruption charges.
abstract: Hiram Monserrate and Carl Kruger, two of four Democratic state senators from New York City who threw the upper house of the Legislature into chaos after the 2008 election, are headed to prison; third, Pedro Espada Jr., is being tried on corruption charges, while fourth, Senator Ruben Diaz Sr, remains in office.
lead_paragraph: After four Democratic state senators orchestrated a coup that temporarily paralyzed state government, two are headed to prison, and one, Pedro Espada Jr., is being tried on corruption charges.

headline.seo: For Three New York Lawmakers, Falls From Grace After an Attempted Coup
headline.main: After a Rebellion That Shook Albany, Three Falls From Grace
headline.print_headline: For 3 State Senators, Falls From Grace After a Rebellion That Shook Albany
